hook.text: Moving your eyes back and forth while recalling trauma sounds strange â€” but it works.

buildup.text: EMDR uses bilateral stimulation to help the brain reprocess traumatic memories.

discovery.text: The theory is that eye movements mimic REM sleep, when the brain naturally processes events.

twist.text: EMDR can achieve results in 6 to 12 sessions that take years with talk therapy.

climax.text: The WHO and VA both recommend EMDR as a first-line PTSD treatment.

punchline.text: Eye movements help the brain finish what trauma interrupted.

quiz.question: How does EMDR help process trauma?
options: Bilateral stimulation helps the brain reprocess memories
